answers.answer: With my daugher they said she was weighing around 8lbs at 37 weeks. I delivered her on my due date (so 40 weeks exactly) & she only weighed 6lb 10oz so I don't think they're always very accurate about weight estimates

At 37 weeks baby was weighing 7lbs 2oz I delivered at 40+4 and she was only 6lbs 8oz. I got induced because I was completely closed and still a 0. My inducement didn't go well I was dilating verrry slowly so I chose to have a csection!
Yes its confusing... Lol... My first born was 10 lbs... and my second one was 7lbs... And for both doc said 8 lbs... For this 3rd pregnancy I still dont kno... Im just 29.weeks
At 35.2 baby measured 6 lbs 15 oz I haven't delivered yet but dr scheduled c section due to complications plus him being "big". I'll let you know results when he's here.
Wow you get a weekly ultrasound?
I have been getting a weekly ultrasound since 37 weeks because I have gestational diabetes.
My blood sugar has been monitored since 32 weeks. I've maybe had 3 or 4 "high" sugars (above 129)...but my fasting sugars are always great. Goal is fasting sugar <100 and 2 hours after meals <129

At my 30 sumthing week ultrasound i was told my bby was 6lb 10onz nd that he would be approx. 8lb but acctualy he was a 10lb 1onz bby ... i was induced nd totally closed i did got to open nd pushed for 45 min after 2 days n a have been im labor .. in the procces of pushing the baby was to big nd couldnt come out so i hade a c-section.
I hope I don't have to get a c section! :/
I had a gf who was told her baby was going to be over 10 pounds abd he camw out just shy of 8 pounds. Its only an eatimate and most the time they are wrong.
Ok that's what I was thinking about the accuracy too. But they will probably say because I have gestational diabetes that I should be induced...:/

At 40+1 they said baby weighed 8 pounds 13 ounces, but baby was born at 8 pounds 5 ounces at 41+2. I got induced for being overdue and ended up with a section because baby had a bowel movement, his heart rate kept dropping, and he had the cord around his neck 3 times. It was intense.
My friend who just had her baby was expecting a little 8 lb baby and he came out and was 11 lbs.. god bless anyone who does it vaginally
Jesus I just don't know what to expect here. I know baby being in the womb as long as possible is best in most situations. I wish my appt was today so I knew what they had in mind already gaww!

question: Had my weekly ultrasound and my son is measuring 9 lbs at 38 weeks...his head is still high up and at my 37 week my cervix was too. I am wondering if any ladies have experienced similar measurements and how it all turned out (did you get induced? How much did the baby weigh? C section or vaginal birth?)
title: 9 lb baby?
